intro: Meibomia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf meibomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Meibomia cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
